title: How to Make Donut Hole Breakfast Kebabs

steps.headline: Decide how many kebabs to make.
steps.description: For each kebab, you'll need approximately 3 donut holes, 3 large strawberries and 3 blackberries, give or take a few.

steps.headline: Prepare the wooden skewers to receive the ingredients by  spraying each skewer liberally with non-stick spray.
steps.description: The spray will prevent the ingredients from sticking to the skewer and allows for easy release.

steps.headline: Add the ingredients to the skewers.
steps.description: String 1 donut hole, 1 strawberry, followed by 1 blackberry onto the skewer. Repeat this step until the entire skewer has been filled. Repeat until all of the kebabs you'd like to make are completed.

steps.headline: Line a platter with either paper doilies or paper towels (to absorb any juice from the fruit).
steps.description: Pile the completed skewers onto the prepared platter, in readiness for dipping.

steps.headline: Prepare the dipping sauces.
steps.description: Pour the salted caramel and chocolate sauces into individual small bowls.

steps.headline: Pour the shredded coconut into a small bowl of its own.

text: Making the Donut Hole Kebabs Decide how many kebabs to make. For each kebab, you'll need approximately 3 donut holes, 3 large strawberries and 3 blackberries, give or take a few. Prepare the wooden skewers to receive the ingredients by  spraying each skewer liberally with non-stick spray. The spray will prevent the ingredients from sticking to the skewer and allows for easy release. Add the ingredients to the skewers. String 1 donut hole, 1 strawberry, followed by 1 blackberry onto the skewer. Repeat this step until the entire skewer has been filled. Repeat until all of the kebabs you'd like to make are completed. Line a platter with either paper doilies or paper towels (to absorb any juice from the fruit). Pile the completed skewers onto the prepared platter, in readiness for dipping. Making the Dipping Sauces Prepare the dipping sauces. Pour the salted caramel and chocolate sauces into individual small bowls. Pour the shredded coconut into a small bowl of its own.
